intro: Warneckea bebaiensis, commonly known as the Bebai warneckea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Cameroon and the Central African Republic. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
